4.7.0.name: WordPress 4.7.0-4.7.1 - Content Type Bypass
4.7.0.description: WordPress 4.7.0 and 4.7.1 are vulnerable to a REST API endpoint content type bypass vulnerability.
4.7.0.impact: An attacker can modify the content of any post or page on the site.
4.7.0.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 4.7.2 or later.

4.7.1.name: WordPress 4.7.0-4.7.1 - Content Type Bypass
4.7.1.description: WordPress 4.7.0 and 4.7.1 are vulnerable to a REST API endpoint content type bypass vulnerability.
4.7.1.impact: An attacker can modify the content of any post or page on the site.
4.7.1.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 4.7.2 or later.

4.8.0.name: WordPress 4.8.0-4.8.1 - Path Traversal in Unzip
4.8.0.description: WordPress 4.8.0 and 4.8.1 are vulnerable to a path traversal vulnerability in the unzip functionality.
4.8.0.impact: An attacker can potentially extract files to arbitrary locations, leading to code execution.
4.8.0.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 4.8.2 or later.

4.8.1.name: WordPress 4.8.0-4.8.1 - Path Traversal in Unzip
4.8.1.description: WordPress 4.8.0 and 4.8.1 are vulnerable to a path traversal vulnerability in the unzip functionality.
4.8.1.impact: An attacker can potentially extract files to arbitrary locations, leading to code execution.
4.8.1.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 4.8.2 or later.

4.9.0.name: WordPress <= 4.9.4 - DoS via load-scripts.php
4.9.0.description: WordPress versions up to 4.9.4 are vulnerable to a denial of service attack via the load-scripts.php file.
4.9.0.impact: An attacker can cause high server load and potentially a denial of service by making requests to load-scripts.php with many script parameters.
4.9.0.recommendation: Implement a WAF rule to block malicious requests to load-scripts.php or update to the latest WordPress version and implement additional protections.

5.0.0.name: WordPress 5.0.0 - Authenticated File Delete
5.0.0.description: WordPress 5.0.0 is vulnerable to an authenticated file deletion issue affecting PHP files.
5.0.0.impact: An authenticated attacker with author privileges can delete certain files, potentially including PHP files.
5.0.0.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 5.0.1 or later.

5.2.3.name: WordPress <= 5.2.3 - Stored XSS in Customizer
5.2.3.description: WordPress versions up to 5.2.3 are vulnerable to a stored XSS vulnerability in the Customizer.
5.2.3.impact: An authenticated attacker with contributor privileges can store malicious JavaScript that would execute when an admin accesses the Customizer.
5.2.3.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 5.2.4 or later.

5.3.0.name: WordPress <= 5.3.0 - Stored XSS in Block Editor
5.3.0.description: WordPress versions up to 5.3.0 are vulnerable to a stored XSS vulnerability in the block editor.
5.3.0.impact: An authenticated attacker with contributor privileges can store malicious JavaScript that would execute when an admin edits the post.
5.3.0.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 5.3.1 or later.

5.4.1.name: WordPress <= 5.4.1 - Authenticated XSS via Media Files
5.4.1.description: WordPress versions up to 5.4.1 are vulnerable to a cross-site scripting vulnerability via media files.
5.4.1.impact: An authenticated attacker can upload specially crafted media files that could lead to cross-site scripting.
5.4.1.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 5.4.2 or later.

5.5.1.name: WordPress <= 5.5.1 - Authenticated Stored XSS
5.5.1.description: WordPress versions up to 5.5.1 are vulnerable to a stored XSS vulnerability.
5.5.1.impact: An authenticated attacker with contributor privileges can store malicious JavaScript that would execute when the post is viewed.
5.5.1.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 5.5.2 or later.

5.7.0.name: WordPress 5.7.0 - XXE Vulnerability
5.7.0.description: WordPress 5.7.0 is vulnerable to an XML External Entity (XXE) vulnerability in the media library.
5.7.0.impact: An authenticated attacker can upload a specially crafted XML file that could lead to server-side request forgery or local file disclosure.
5.7.0.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 5.7.1 or later.

5.8.2.name: WordPress <= 5.8.2 - SQL Injection
5.8.2.description: WordPress versions up to 5.8.2 are vulnerable to a SQL injection vulnerability.
5.8.2.impact: An authenticated attacker with author privileges can inject arbitrary SQL queries, potentially leading to database access or modification.
5.8.2.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 5.8.3 or later.

6.0.2.name: WordPress <= 6.0.2 - XSS in Link Processing
6.0.2.description: WordPress versions up to 6.0.2 are vulnerable to a cross-site scripting vulnerability in link processing.
6.0.2.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript via specially crafted links.
6.0.2.recommendation: Update WordPress to version 6.0.3 or later.

5.3.1.name: Contact Form 7 <= 5.3.1 - Unrestricted File Upload
5.3.1.description: Contact Form 7 versions up to 5.3.1 are vulnerable to an unrestricted file upload vulnerability.
5.3.1.impact: An attacker can upload arbitrary files, potentially including PHP files, which could lead to remote code execution.
5.3.1.recommendation: Update Contact Form 7 to version 5.3.2 or later.

5.5.0.name: WooCommerce <= 5.5.0 - SQL Injection
5.5.0.description: WooCommerce versions up to 5.5.0 are vulnerable to a SQL injection vulnerability.
5.5.0.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can inject arbitrary SQL queries, potentially leading to database access or modification.
5.5.0.recommendation: Update WooCommerce to version 5.5.1 or later.

3.1.3.name: Elementor <= 3.1.3 - Authenticated Stored XSS
3.1.3.description: Elementor versions up to 3.1.3 are vulnerable to a stored XSS vulnerability.
3.1.3.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when the page is viewed.
3.1.3.recommendation: Update Elementor to version 3.1.4 or later.

1.7.1.name: WP Super Cache <= 1.7.1 - Authenticated RCE
1.7.1.description: WP Super Cache versions up to 1.7.1 are vulnerable to a remote code execution vulnerability.
1.7.1.impact: An authenticated attacker with admin privileges can execute arbitrary PHP code.
1.7.1.recommendation: Update WP Super Cache to version 1.7.2 or later.

7.5.2.name: Wordfence <= 7.5.2 - Authentication Bypass
7.5.2.description: Wordfence versions up to 7.5.2 are vulnerable to an authentication bypass vulnerability.
7.5.2.impact: An unauthenticated attacker can bypass authentication and gain admin access to the site.
7.5.2.recommendation: Update Wordfence to version 7.5.3 or later.

16.6.name: Yoast SEO <= 16.6 - Authenticated Stored XSS
16.6.description: Yoast SEO versions up to 16.6 are vulnerable to a stored XSS vulnerability.
16.6.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when the page is viewed.
16.6.recommendation: Update Yoast SEO to version 16.7 or later.

1.5.name: Twenty Twenty <= 1.5 - Authenticated Stored XSS
1.5.description: Twenty Twenty theme versions up to 1.5 are vulnerable to a stored XSS vulnerability.
1.5.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when the page is viewed.
1.5.recommendation: Update Twenty Twenty theme to version 1.6 or later.

2.5.4.name: Astra <= 2.5.4 - Authenticated Stored XSS
2.5.4.description: Astra theme versions up to 2.5.4 are vulnerable to a stored XSS vulnerability.
2.5.4.impact: An authenticated attacker can inject malicious JavaScript that would execute when the page is viewed.
2.5.4.recommendation: Update Astra theme to version 2.5.5 or later.
